result.execSummary:
The defendant Avery J Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 35 days were granted. Time Served.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial incarceration credit and revocation summary
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Avery J Nelson in court with Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is struck.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

35 DAYS JAIL   (35 days credit)   *TIME SERVED*

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted-remainder to be returned to poster)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-11-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Avery J Nelson in court with Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Redetzke requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 01/25/16.
Hearing at 01-25-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Avery J Nelson in court, in custody, with Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Redetzke states he will be filing a motion to suppress (will need 1 hour).  Court adjourns for further proceedings as motion is not yet filed.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
